datafield.subfield: Life and Miracles of St. Simeon of Padolirone :
Use: Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use

Contents include: 1. fol. 1: prologue; 2. fol. 2r-15v: vita in twenty-seven chapters; 3. fol. 15v-19v: post-mortem miracles in thirteen chapters; 4. fol. 20r: letter of Pope Benedict VII authorizing the building of a church in honor of St. Simeon; 5. fol. 20v: letter of Pope Leo authorizing the dedication of the church by the Bishop of Mantua.
Paolo Golinelli, La 'vita' di S. Simeone monaco, Studi Medievali, 3d ser., 20 (1979): 734-36.

MS 3327, Container 105: Notes of content in German on the inside front cover; acquired by the Ransom Center (R5374) in 1973 from Jenkins and Company. Bibliography: The text of the vita was printed in the Acta Sanctorum. Binding (Italy 17th c): Full brown tanned goatskin over paper boards. Pulled-over caps, cut-solid edges gilded, tight back over sewing supports, transverse spine linings with extensions adhered to inside of boards. Blind-tooled border of fillet lines, concentric frame, small and large arabesques gold-tooled in border and frame corners and combined in gold-tooled centerpiece, front and back covers; gold tooling on spine; title written in ink above centerpiece front cover. Four fastenings (pairs of ribbon ties) centered head and tail and two on fore edge. Sewn on six tanned animal skin thongs laced on boards. Sewn endbands (blue/pink) over alum-tawed cores adhered to inside of boards, front bead. Endleaf components: front text-hook off-white handmade laid paper endleaves (two nested), sewn with gathering, making pastedown, free endleaf; back same.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
